Tucson nodds and does as asked of him.

"Very well. I'm happy to see that a=
ll of you are showing the initiative to have faith in the unknown.  This wi=
ll only strengthen our bonds and our forces."

He then turns his head towar=
d the direction of Rodimus.

"I notice you're a tad quiet Rodimus, I unders=
tand if something is bothering you and I'm here to listen if you need to ge=
t a few things off your mind.  I realize that you have been through a lot, =
and most of it unpleasent.  I assure you Hydras will not get away with what=
 he did to you and neither will the rest of his lackies."

A stone solid lo=
ok of determination comes over Tucson's face.  Like Optimus he was not one =
to shy away from working toward a resolve. 

" And if I must, if given the =
challenge, I will face him if he so choses, on a one to one basis.  He took=
 something very valuable away from me, my comrades, and my friends.  And no=
w, it's time I took something away from him."
